subtitle: Hello everyone, after a few questions from people i wanted to talk about something that is innately
spiritual but unlike most spiritual topics it's very well known amongst everyone rather
than just the few if not the most spiritually valued thing in life that transcends countries
cultures and history and this aspect is of course love and relationships whether you care about
relationships or not this aspect of life affects us all we all have parents who join together to
conceive us after all and at first especially if you've never been in a committed or
intimate relationship you might not understand how relationships are spiritual at all and of course
on the surface it all just seems like maybe flirting with someone playing games with them
exchanging glances going on romantic dates but on a deeper level the drive to do all
of this does come from the spiritual realm not just from pure desire or lust but a longing to
feel complete not just with someone else but with our own inner divinity
even an abstinent monk needs to learn about this passionate longing to be unified with God in a way
this spiritual or religious union is not too different from the longing to have union
with someone else and actually for someone who is not spiritual this intense passion
to be with someone can sometimes be felt even more intensely because they put all their eggs
into one basket so to speak they look for that union and satisfaction within the other person
instead of using that person as a mirror to understand themselves or the divine nature of
the greater whole is that not a great burden to put on someone... is that not selfish? is that called
love? to ask another person to give you that kind of existential happiness or wholeness?
this puts so much expectation on our partners to be perfect and of course when they don't meet that
unrealistic criteria it can lead to disappointment anger hatred fear of loss jealousy possessiveness
controlling behavior and all of that saddening behavior that you see when couples argue
this derives from attachment and dependence and amongst all of this deep complexity and
psychology of the ego lust can also arise and damage a relationship which is linked to
the episode i made about sexual transmutation now if you're feeling even more confused about
what i'm saying you're probably thinking well if relationships are so hard and petty how could it
possibly benefit me spiritually? Well truly if approached in the correct way it can be one of
the most powerful tools for self-transformation knowing yourself and growing in wisdom it can
change your character for the better completely making you a more heart-centered person overall
however this is usually not the case for most people as most people end up in divorce
i don't mean divorce as in divorce papers but the actual spiritual meaning of energetically
separating from someone just like how if you are with someone deeply and devotedly then you are
spiritually married to that person whether you sign papers or have a ceremony or not you see
modern society has almost completely lost the spiritual meaning and understanding of marriage
and today it is just this trivial half-hearted sexual matter that people have no value or
psychological or spiritual direction in even through the centuries of religious devolvement
have they labeled sex as sinful and relationships almost having nothing to do with enlightenment
which is of course a tragedy to see the only type of love that they value is of course the love of
Jesus, Krishna, Buddha and other Gods but this is still a love that is totally unrelated to
daily life so you see on the surface as a human we are all one half male or female yin or yang
and we are in nature one side of a polarity hence why there is this sexual magnetic attractive force
to another sex and to avoid too many issues in relationships we first have to be full in our own
half first and then overflow and give from there because love gives more than it receives you
know when a relationship starts it's all beauty happiness and ecstasy right we commonly call this
the honeymoon period then usually after around six months to a year or maybe sooner or later
depending on how often they see each other the two souls will eventually begin to do the real
work together and hence this is why you begin to see arguments and it's usually around this time
especially in this day and age where people don't understand love and relationships this is when
most people break up between that six months to a year period most people cannot handle the
real passionate flames of integrating with another soul after this honeymoon period it's a spiritual
challenge innately and through a love-based relationship we can have one of the most
powerful mirrors to see our own egos which the other person will eventually tell us about and
after several years of this integration if the couple is successful and has gotten through most
of their trials so to speak then they begin to understand about unconditional love which leads to
more enlightened and authentic and spiritual happiness and a more conscious relationship with
the other person now this is such an enormous topic and i could very much argue as well as
many other enlightened schools would that this topic of love is the single most sublime
and important teaching out of all of spirituality not just love for another person but being in
a relationship can teach you about love itself by almost forcing you to open up your own heart
if you want to stay with a particular person so in future episodes i will of course talk more about
love intimacy lust and relationships but for now in this episode i want to talk about some of the
spiritual benefits or the fundamentals of why being in a relationship with your so-called
other half can help you spiritually and why it has this effect of maturing your consciousness
whether you've never been with someone in that way or have been for a long time or perhaps you feel
disconnected from your partner because you're spiritual and they
aren't the information here should be applicable to all so firstly in order to talk about love
let's just talk briefly about what love actually is because the word love is like the word god
it's a completely overused word and has lost its meaning over time and through seeking to find some
kind of definitive understanding of what love is it will also very much connect to the main message
of this episode which is about the benefits of being in love or being in a relationship
so we all have our different definitions of what love is but let's try to look at it differently
without any judgment or personal opinion so that we can really understand it in its essence
because remember by trying to define and conclude something compared with our own little experience
then we close ourselves off from understanding it in its direct full reality here and now for
example some people walk around in a chronic state of holding a firm and stubborn opinion
or conclusion about what love is and therefore they stop any possibility of experiencing the
reality of it usually because they had some bitter experience with it in the past so by trying to
find the reality of love without defining it totally you have to inquire into it yourself i
of course cannot just tell you or show you what love is by simply making this episode and you
just listening to it and so you can start asking questions to yourself like is love pleasure for
most people it is whether it's sexual pleasure or having pleasurable experiences with that person
a lot of people call that love and the greater their happiness or pleasure the greater they
call their love and so when people identify love with pleasure they are really only seeking
or identifying with pleasure i'm not saying that love does not encompass
pleasure but love is not exclusively that and in practice most people do not understand that
and can't commit to a relationship because of that misunderstanding or because of those
expectations that they thought love was so what happens when this is the case and you only expect
pleasurable experiences well of course you'll be sorely disappointed and experience resistance and
suffering and will not enjoy what is supposed to be a sacred experience of the union of two souls
and so if you only see love as pleasure you must also see the whole reality and consequence
of pleasure and what is on the other spectrum of pleasure pain the two cannot exist without
the other and pain is the exact reason of why most people get into relationships in the first place
usually people get into relationships because they were already aware of some pain within them
to start with for example many of us may perceive that we are depressed or in sorrow and resist it
and try to use a relationship as a form of escape but then are you really using that relationship
for love or are you using it to mask your inner struggling reality with the experience of ignorant
pleasure you see in this case one has taken their own self-concern and has began to depend
on someone for their own way to cope with their internal state of mind or state of being that
they cannot cope with is this love using someone to fill a void or depressive state so if we choose
not to rely on someone for that which we commonly call love then where does love actually come from
where does this sensation of fullness arise come from if we do not get it from someone else
where does it come from if it is impossible for someone else to really make you happy you see
when one experiences self-pity fear anxiety self-concern we are of course in need of love
but not from outside of you but from within something needs healing
and so in order to cure our chronic self-pity self-importance self-involvement what we need
is attention and of course almost everyone needs healing in some form or another right
and so you see manifested in the personalities of many people uh as these attention seekers
they seek attention because unfortunately sadly they don't know how to give attention
to themselves so they seek it from other people and so the kind of attention i'm talking about in
order to heal ourselves is not just regular egoic ordinary pleasurable attention that's filled with
judgments opinions beliefs whether positive or negative but i am talking about complete
undivided unconditional objective unattached attention that is what we could also call love and
this kind of attention is only accessed through each and every person's innermost consciousness
this is how we really see what state of mind we are in and how we can give ourselves attention
and heal ourselves and when one becomes totally aware of one's own lack or self-pity that voice
from within that says little old me is incomplete then it disappears only when you really see it
does it disappear to have full attention means to understand your suffering totally this is love
to see yourself absolutely now of course please forgive me because there is no way
to give an ultimate definition for this kind of attention called love i can only seek to point
towards the reality of it with my limited use of words but this total attention which
is also called love has no judgments please be mindful i'm not saying don't be non-judgmental
i'm saying that complete attention is innately non-judgmental think about
some of the most memorable times in your life where you were intensely in the present moment
happy blissful aware of everything around you not a care in the world for other matters or problems
or world affairs and perhaps in those moments you came to some realizations where everything makes
sense was there not this quality or perfume of love to further point towards the intelligence
of this sensation of love within it also has no clinging to pleasure or pain but accepts both
and sees them for what they are and when you see pleasure and pain for what they are you can have
full awareness and acceptance of the comings and goings of pleasure and pain whenever they arise
it's only when we resist this ebb and flow and drama of life is when we have no
love so simply being full in yourself having this attention this quality of full attention implies
an innate love and so to start a point towards the benefits of relationships it takes immense
love immense attention to get through the soul challenges of integrating with another soul
this is why those with wisdom are full of love because they had to surrender their clinging to
pleasure and accept pain or the illusion of pain in order to see why they suffer in the first place
love embraces great pain just as much as it embraces pleasure love never avoids pain it
accepts it as gracefully as flowers wilt away or as worlds collide as they are destroyed in space
if you lose someone and you are empty depressed anxious sad well now you are self-concerned
right and your attention is more about yourself rather than the person who has passed away
and so did you really love that person or are you just depressed that you no longer have something
to fill your void i'm not saying it's bad to be upset and grieve your partner if they pass away
of course that is absolutely natural but there is this quality of higher states of love and
enlightened relationships where one can experience enlightenment rather than just pain on one side
there is this unbearable egoic suffering where one feels sorry for oneself and on the other hand
there is this understanding there's still pain but there is understanding and there isn't this
horrible hole that you used to fill instead there is just a small loss but you are still full within
yourself so by being aware in this moment of your life love exists this is totally and utterly true
but not everyone will see that one might say i see where i am i am present but i feel no love it is
not about being or not being in love being highly aware in this moment of this strange experience
of life implies love love is attention attention is love but if you do not sense this quality of
direct reality then you are simply not being aware enough of penetrating beyond all the psychological
personified colorations of the egoic opinions and thinking and compulsions the mind is too
loud meditation is needed to silence the objects in consciousness that block the light of attention
which is our compulsive thoughts melodramatic emotions self-concerns
beliefs intellectualizations etc etc one has to be radically surrendered to a higher state
of consciousness to understand love and how reality and love is not separate they
are inseparable just as love and relationships are inseparable just how love and religion and
the spiritual path is inseparable now apply this principle of unconditional
attention to being in a relationship and try to see why this could benefit us spiritually you see
one of the highest benefits of relationships is for the spiritual psychological work on oneself
meaning a deeper awareness of yourself temet know thyself the other person becomes a powerful and
intense mirror for your own shortcomings you could argue that this isn't the case but you will always
see that the other person will eventually test you in some way and you'll feel the temptation to fall
into some form of unconsciousness they will if they really care tell you what you do wrong and
from there you can either take a path of growth or a path of anger the path of growth encompasses
this total attention the path of anger chooses to close off its eyes to the truths about itself
the other person may not necessarily be completely right in their judgments about you
but there is usually some reality or some reason within you as to why they're presenting
this challenge or this statement or judgment about you you know many people want to mold
their partner into what they want for their ego rather than having the love to let that person
blossom into who they are meant to be into what god intended them to be right and so you also
have to ask yourself why do i want that person to be that way am i just projecting a copy of my own
ego onto them is that love to imagine what they are meant to be rather than trying to perceive who
they are meant to grow into as their own soul love is not possessive and it is especially not part of
an enlightened relationship so if you really want to stay with that person you have to learn a
greater level of devotion commitment and sacrifice of your own egoic desires if you really want to
continue you need a much greater level of love in other words you need a much greater level
of unconditional undivided pure awareness pure attention of yourself and the situation and have
the lack of self-importance to be able to see it completely only then will you understand the
situations and arguments at hand and be able to learn about them and yourself and through getting
these challenges of course you get into greater levels of love with your partner and start to grow
together as these two polarities of consciousness create a greater whole a greater being
merging with another person is like having an amplified consciousness and you can absolutely
grow in this way powerfully and so this soul's challenge in relationships and its problems that
arise can become even more problematic because it's always easier to see the things that are
wrong in the other person first rather than choosing to see what's wrong with us personally
we're always justified or always full of our own ego that it makes it so difficult to see what
we've done wrong this is why love is the highest form of intelligent comprehension of oneself
this emotional journey that you can take with someone else forces the heart to open up blessed
are those who love as it says in many teachings and in many spiritual groups even including
gnosticism it was always uh recommended that someone actually find a partner
so that they can start to be exposed to the other polarity of energy whether it's male or female
and initiate these challenges within so that we can have greater opportunity to grow right
after many years of wise practice with someone else you can very much begin to understand this
yin and yang and male and female principle and how men or the male energetic
force usually has its positives and negatives of how a man can be very much logical and reasonable
but also lacking in emotional intelligence and a woman can absolutely benefit from that
and on the other spectrum a woman can be highly emotionally intelligent but lack
that logic and reason so that you know she isn't too emotional of course that is a very generic
stereotype and i'm just pointing towards a deeper reality of where these two energies of polarity
come from and how they can work together and benefit each other if you're a spiritual person
and you're not in a relationship and you don't have many challenges in your personal life perhaps
your financial situation is very comfortable and you don't have any temptations at all but you're
not really much of an enlightened person then if you need or if you want to feel more challenged if
you want more opportunities for growth get into a relationship and see where it takes
you and all the challenges that come with it almost everyone in the world knows this whether
spiritual or not every member of humanity is a reflection of our self and when we get into
an intimate relationship this reflection becomes greatly amplified and it becomes very intense and
if you can become present or stay present during those times you have no choice but either to
grow as a person and overcome those spiritual challenges or end the relationship and of course
most people will choose to end it but if you can get through it then you will
come out a much better person and the relationship with that other person will go much deeper
much more meaningful a lot of people say okay i don't want to be with that person they end it and
they overlook the fact that the problems came from within themselves and if they end a relationship
because of a particular issue that they could not deal with they will absolutely experience the same
issues with the other person if not more because it calls upon now the second time with the second
person deeply ingrained pain that was not dealt with years ago and they put even more expectation
onto this other person and they say no this can't be happening again i just went through a whole
honeymoon period stage everything was perfect and now i've got the exact same problems
and this is just a disaster and that person if they are wise enough they have to finally learn
this kind of karmic lesson to surrender to look in the mirror to look at themselves and say okay
i'm going to let go of this baggage that is causing me issues and causing me a
less happier life with this person and with this relationship so if you're in a relationship try to
practice being present with your other half if you've been with them long enough you will know
that there are some things that irritate you about them or some things that they do
to trigger you in those moments try or just do practice being intensely present having this full
awareness of the here and now this total attention it takes greater will to do that in those moments
you know it's very easy to be present while you have your incense in your room a candle some nice
music but the real challenge is being present in the face of these moments where you are being
egoically challenged and if you can stay present during those times then you will be even much more
deeply present during your spiritual practices such as meditation if you do not react if you are
completely understanding in those moments where you are perhaps being insulted or something like
that that happens in relationships these kind of funny petty arguments and you are graceful
and loving you will completely grow energetically in your consciousness in gnosticism they call this
the psychological gym of life because in many aspects of life at work with other strangers we
all have these challenges because people annoy us we get angry but it is especially more applicable
to intimate relationships i hope that makes sense that the spiritual benefits of being in
relationships are having a tool for consciousness to grow psychologically to learn to surrender
and sacrifice yourself for another person not physically obviously but psychologically to learn
how to be complete in yourself rather than relying on someone else and of course to also learn how
to help another person awaken spiritually that doesn't mean they necessarily need to
read spiritual books or meditate but to help that person be as full as they can of themselves as in
for them to grow in wisdom as well and to help them overcome their own spiritual challenges
again this is a huge topic feel free to ask me to cover episodes on specific details about it
or just ask questions below if you liked this episode it can be a sort of introduction to
more like this to come a quick shout out to Tevin, Teemo, Joshua, mailg, and Lemonjelly-swift
who all joined the Patreon group if you want to support the channel too
there's a link in the description below where you get access to the Astral Doorway Discord group
we're having another live discussion in there tomorrow if you want to talk about this kind
of topic with like-minded people this is Gene and i'll see you on the next episode.
